unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Binomial Distribution: Manipulating the Binomial Formula
question_text:
A random variable $X$ has the probability
$$\begin{pmatrix} 20 \\ k \end{pmatrix}(0.44)^{k}(0.56)^{20-k}$$
...associated with the value $k$ for $k= 0,1,2,3,…,20$.
What is the mean of $X$?
solution:
The formula given in this example is the binomial formula (formula is given on the AP exam)

$$\begin{pmatrix} n \\ k \end{pmatrix}(p)^{k}(1-p)^{n-k}$$

The mean of binomial distribution is given by the formula(formula is given on AP exam)
$$\mu =n\bullet p$$

In our case, since $n=20$ and $p=0.44$,

$$\mu=20\bullet 0.44=8.8$$

Choice 'C' is our answer.

Explanations of Distractors Choice 'A' is incorrect as this value is computed by 10∙0.44 Choice 'B' is incorrect as this value is computed by 10∙0.56 Choice 'D' is incorrect as this value is computed by 20∙0.50 Choice 'E' is incorrect as this value is computed by 20∙0.56
